stepAnswer: A positive angle is measured counterclockwise from the positive $$x-axis$$, while a negative angle is measured clockwise from the positive $$x-axis$$.
stepTitle: State what a positive or negative angle signifies, and explain how to draw each.
choices: A positive angle is measured counterclockwise from the positive $$x-axis$$, while a negative angle is measured clockwise from the positive $$x-axis$$.
A positive angle is always drawn from the negative $$x-axis$$, and a negative angle is always drawn from the positive $$y-axis$$.
A positive angle is any angle greater than 90°, and a negative angle is any angle less than 90°.
A positive angle is measured clockwise from the positive $$x-axis$$, while a negative angle is measured counterclockwise from the positive $$x-axis$$.
A positive angle is measured counterclockwise from the positive $$x-axis$$, while a negative angle is measured clockwise from the positive $$x-axis$$.
